alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 08 at 1:32AM MST until November 09 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THIS EVENING THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, Central Carbon County, North Snowy Range Foothills, Southwest Carbon County and Upper North Platte River Basin. * WHEN...From late this evening through early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Light weight and high profile vehicles including light load semis and those towing camper trailers will be at risk.
info.instruction: A High Wind Watch means a hazardous high wind event is possible. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
